headline.main: Radisson and SAS Form Hotel Pact

docs.lead_paragraph: Hoping to create a larger global presence, Radisson Hotels International announced yesterday that it has formed an alliance with SAS International Hotels, a subsidiary of Scandinavian Airlines System. The agreement includes 30 SAS hotels in nine European countries, as well as in Kuwait and China. And it gives SAS the right to develop additional Radisson hotels in Europe. SAS will manage and operate the hotels, which will soon bear the Radisson/ SAS Hotels Worldwide logo, while Radisson will market them around the world and link the hotels to its existing reservations system.
docs.snippet: Hoping to create a larger global presence, Radisson Hotels International announced yesterday that it has formed an alliance with SAS International Hotels, a subsidiary of Scandinavian Airlines System.   The agreement includes 30 SAS hotels in nine...

headline.print_headline: Rooms for Rent-Australian Hotels Expand Rapidly to Catch Chinese Tourism Boom
headline.main: Rooms for Rent-Australian Hotels Expand Rapidly to Catch Chinese Tourism Boom

docs.lead_paragraph: The hole in Australia's economy dug by China's dwindling appetite for its resources is being filled by the Chinese themselves, whose growing affluence is powering a surge in travellers in a boon to tourism income and growth.

headline.seo: Hypoallergenic Hotel Rooms, for a Price

docs.lead_paragraph: Two hotel chains are designating allergy-friendly rooms, with things like medical-grade air purifiers and chemical- and fragrance-free bath products.

headline.main: Détente in the Hotel Bed Wars

docs.abstract: Christopher Elliott Sounding Off column on whether or not 'bed wars' among hotels is over; latest salvo in changes to beds, linens, and pillows, which began in 1999 with introduction of Heavenly Bed by Westin Hotels and Resorts, may have come with Hilton Hotels' $1 billion effort that includes branded Serenity Bed and accoutrements; business travelers, some of whom say some hotels have gone overboard, comment (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: THE hotel ''bed wars'' are over. But are business travelers the winners? Most frequent travelers would probably say they are, citing the remarkable evolution of hotel beds from the no-nonsense affairs of the late 1990's -- just mattresses, sheets and bedspreads -- to the superpremium sleep ''experiences'' of today.
docs.snippet: The hotel "bed wars" are over. But are business travelers the winners?...

headline.print_headline: New Hotel Finds a Welcome in Asbury Park
headline.main: New Asbury Park Hotel May Signal a Long-Awaited Revival

docs.abstract: Some residents of Asbury Park, NJ, view planned boutique hotel The Asbury as promising sign for revitalization of area; hotel, which will be first new one in city in almost half-century when it opens in May, follows series of other redevelopment projects.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Asbury, a boutique hotel scheduled to open in May, follows a string of attempts at revitalizing the New Jersey resort city.

headline.seo: Hotel Review: Andaz Napa in Napa, Calif.
headline.main: Hotel Review: Andaz Napa in Napa, Calif.

docs.abstract: Freda Moon reviews Andaz Napa hotel in Napa, Calif.
docs.lead_paragraph: This downtown hotel, opened in September, is within walking distance of several tasting rooms and offers amenities that include a roof deck with a fire pit.
